description.narrative: By end-2018, Ecuador has improved information, technical exchanges and evidence related to social protection and the reduction of poverty, especially multidimensional child poverty, with a gender perspective.

mailing-address.narrative: Av. Amazonas 2889 y La Granja Edificio Naciones Unidas Quito

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Children and adolescent participating in the planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of UNICEF programmes
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Ecuador United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Ecuador 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Ecuador Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end-2018, Ecuador has improved information, technical exchanges and evidence related to social protection and the reduction of poverty, especially multidimensional child poverty, with a gender perspective.

description.narrative: Análisis y propuestas de metodologías y programas para apoyar al Estado ecuatoriano a fortalecer un sistema de protección social sensible a la niñez y a la adolescencia. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2019

title.narrative: 1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures
Number of instruments for the analysis, diagnosis and monitoring of multidimensional child poverty and inequalities, with a gender perspective.

target.value: 2018:An instrument to monitor key indicators on multidimensional child poverty and inequalities developed.

actual.value: 2018:A methodology approach to multidimensional child poverty in Ecuador has developed. Results area expected to be released towards the end fo 2019

title.narrative: Mechanisms for identifying, reporting, analyzing and monitoring the investment in children and adolescents and its quality, with a gender perspective

baseline.value: Classifier of spending on children and adolescents existing but with incipient application.

target.value: 2018:An inter-institutional mechanism for monitoring investment in children and adolescents, proposed and publicized, with a gender perspective

actual.value: 2018:UNICEF Ecuador supported the development a methodology and a report of social investment in children and adolescents in three prioritized territories (at subnational level).

title.narrative: Mechanisms for observation and monitoring of the policies, programmes, plans of action and rights of children and adolescents, with emphasis on the reduction gaps and perspective of equality, non-discrimination and gender.

baseline.value: Proposal for observance of rights prepared, initial instruments for State-civil society co-responsibility and monitoring of the rights of indigenous children

target.value: 2018:A mechanism for observance and monitoring functioning at the national and local level, with a gender approach

actual.value: 2018:During 2018, a SitAn was developed and released in early 2019.

title.narrative: Existence of a social protection floor policy, with emphasis on the most vulnerable children and adolescents

baseline.value: Social protection floor policy under construction

target.value: 2018:Social protection floor policy being applied, with emphasis on children and adolescents in situations of vulnerability
